Transript:
M: Hi, Kelly. Did you see our advertisement in this month’s issue of Fishing Fanatic? Q1 The accompanying graphic shows how our fishing rods are stronger than any other product on the market.
W: Yeah, I saw it this morning. Q2 I’m hoping the advertisement will help convince customers to purchase our newest line of fishing rods.
M: Q3 I’m sure it will. I’ll get in touch with the advertising agency and request that the ad be placed in other magazines as well.

question.text: What is mentioned about the product?
choices: (C) It is safe for children to use.

question.text: According to the man, what will the advertisement help to do?
What will the man do next?

answer.explanation:
W: Hi, Josh. You work at Sentry Insurance, don’t you? Q1 I heard from a friend they are expected to merge with another company. Is your position secure?
M: Yes, no problem. I will be keeping my position. Q2 In fact, my company plans to expand internationally so that we can compete with other global corporations. I’m certain it will be beneficial for both me and my company.
W: I’m glad to hear that. Actually, I’ve recently been thinking about changing my line of employment. Will there be any opportunities for getting hired at your company?
M: Q3 Well, you should visit my company’s website because we are posting new job positions that will be available after the merger.

question.text: What does the woman say she has heard about?
What benefit does the man mention?
What does the man suggest the woman do?

answer.explanation:
M: Did you enjoy this afternoon’s training session for the new software? Q1 I think it’ll really help us improve the quality of our graphic design work.
W: I thought it was very informative, but there are still a lot of details that I’m unsure about. Q2 I wish the instructor had allowed some time for participants to ask questions.
M: Yeah, I agree with you. However, I heard that the instructor of the training session left his contact information with the human resources department. Q3 Why don’t you try contacting him via e-mail?

question.text: Where most likely do the speakers work?
What is the woman’s complaint about the training session?
choices: (B) The registration fee was too high.
(C) There was no time for inquiries.

answer.text: (C) There was no time for inquiries.

question.text: What does the man suggest?

answer.explanation:
W: Marcus, have you finished designing the layout for our new online clothing store? Q1 I’m really excited to start selling our clothes online as well as at the offline store. Can I see the website?
M: Sure, but there are still a few changes I would like to make. I'm worried that some customers might get confused while navigating the website. Q2 I think I need to simplify the interface more. What do you think?
W: Actually, I like it the way it is. I don’t think it’s too confusing. Q3 However, I think we need to add more photographs of the products. If customers can’t see exactly how the products look, they might be discouraged from making a purchase online.

question.text: Where do the speakers work?
What does the man want to do with the website?
What does the woman suggest doing?

answer.explanation:
Transript:
M1: Heights Department store, Michael speaking, how can I help you?
W: Hi, this is Sarah. Q1 I purchased a Regan cashmere coat from you two weeks ago, but I still haven’t received it yet. I was told that I’d get it in 2-3 days.
M1: Hold on a second, Q2 you’ll need to speak with a representative from the Regan boutique. I’ll transfer your call.
W: No problem.
M2: Hello, this is Regan Luxury Boutique, Brian speaking, what can I help you with?
W: Yes, Brian, this is Sarah. I bought a coat from you two weeks ago and I’m wondering what happened to the shipment.
M2: Oh, hello Sarah, I’m sorry to hear that you haven’t received it yet. Let me check the computer here. Q3 Can you give me your full name?
W: Sure, it’s Sarah Jane Park.

question.text: Why is the woman calling?
choices: (B) She was overcharged for the item.
(D) She wants to return a product.

question.text: Why does Michael transfer the call?
choices: (A) He is busy with another customer.

question.text: What does Brian ask the woman for?

answer.explanation:
M: Hi, Ms. Parker? This is Joseph sterling from Green Creek Realtors. Q1 We need to talk about an issue with the apartment you wanted.
W: Oh, hi Joseph. Did you manage to find me a place in the Kahlua Apartment building?
M: Yes, that’s the reason I’m calling. But there is a bit of an issue.
W: Really? What is it?
M: Q2 There is a major pest problem in the building, and they need to clear the whole building and carry out pest control. It’s going to take them at least three months to make sure the building is clean. So you would have to wait three months to get a place there...
W: I see...
M: There is a building just nearby called Graceville Towers. It’s very close to the Kahlua building so you could stay there for three months then move over to the Kahlua building. Q3 I will arrange ail of the moving for you. Why don’t you go online and check out Graceville Towers and get back to me?
W: Sure, that sounds good. Thanks Joseph.

question.text: What is the reason for Joseph’s call?
choices: (A) There is a problem with the apartment.
(B) To sign the contract for the apartment
(D) To discuss the price of rent

answer.text: (A) There is a problem with the apartment.

question.text: What does Joseph say about the Kahlua Apartment?
choices: (A) It’s ready to move in anytime.
(C) It is near a new fitness center.
(D) There is a major pest problem.

answer.text: (D) There is a major pest problem.

question.text: What does Joseph offer to do?
choices: (A) Find a new apartment at Graceville Towers
(D) Move into the Kahlua Apartment building

answer.explanation:
M: Welcome back, Catherine. I hope you are feeling better after recovering from the flu. Q1 I wanted to make sure you know about the new policy concerning sick leave.
W: I did hear that now we need to submit a doctor’s note along with the sick leave form. Q2 Will I still be paid the same amount for my sick leave as I would a normal workday?
M: Actually, the terms of compensation have changed as well. Q3 I’ll print out a copy of the new policy and leave it on your desk later today. If you have more questions, you should contact Jennifer in Human Resources.

question.text: What is the topic of the conversation?
What does the woman ask about?
What will the man most likely do next?

answer.explanation:
W: Hello, this is Julia Kramer calling from Human Resources. Q1 I gave your department a laptop computer to be fixed last week and I still haven’t received an update. The keyboard needed to be replaced.
M: Ah, yes, Ms. Kramer. We have had a lot of work orders lately, so we are a little behind with repairs. Is the matter urgent?
W: Q2 Well, I just forgot to copy an important file off the hard drive that I need for my work.
M: I can transfer that file onto a storage device for you. Q3 Come to my office at your convenience.

question.text: Which department does the man most likely work in?
What is the woman unable to do?
What does the man suggest doing?

answer.explanation:
M: Hi, Sarah. Q1 I’m making plans for the next w business conference in the summer. What venues would you recommend?
W: Q2 I think Highwind Hotel has great conference rooms and all the necessary equipment you might need. I’ve planned seminars as well as weddings there and they always do a great job.
M: Alright, I’ll give them a call and reserve their spaces today.
W: Did you release a newsletter about it yet?
M: No, I just want to confirm the venues first and then we’ll start sending out emails and newsletters.
W: Great, Q3 let me know if you need any help.
M: Thanks, in fact, can you take a look at a draft I’m working on? I’d like your opinion on it.

question.text: What does the man talk about?
What does the woman mention about the venue?
choices: (B) She had her wedding at the venue.
(C) The venue may be booked quickly.

question.text: What does the woman offer to do?

answer.explanation:
Transript:
M: Hi, Mrs. West. Q1 Everything is setup for your anniversary party tonight. If you can arrive at about 6:00 P.M., that would be great.
W: 6:00 P.M.? I have meetings until 8:00 P.M. tonight. You know we are merging with another company at the moment; it’s a very important time for our company.
M: Oh no... I’ve scheduled the band to play from six to ten o’clock. And dinner will be served at seven o’clock.
W: Well, I wish you would have told me about this earlier.
M: Q2 But it’s your fifth year anniversary party...
W: OK. Q3 I will cancel my last meeting tonight and arrive around six thirty. So don’t worry; everything will be fine. I will just be a little late.

question.text: What are the speakers mainly discussing?
What does the man mean when he says “But it’s your fifth year anniversary party”?
choices: (A) He wants her to change her schedule.
(C) He will tell the band not to come.
(D) He wants her to go to the meetings.

answer.text: (A) He wants her to change her schedule.

question.text: What solution does the woman provide?
choices: (B) She will cancel the dinner service.
